meanings.definition: Not forming an essential part; secondary.
meanings.sent1: The decorations are nonbasic to the main structure of the house.
meanings.sent2: The extra toppings on the pizza are nonbasic and can be removed.
meanings.sent3: The nonbasic glitter on the birthday card made it sparkle even more.
meanings.sent4: Her nonbasic laughter filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The nonbasic details in the painting brought it to life.

meanings.definition: Not belonging to the foundation or basis; extraneous.
meanings.sent1: The fancy font used in the report is nonbasic to its content.
meanings.sent2: The unnecessary buttons on the remote control are nonbasic features.
meanings.sent3: The nonbasic umbrella hat kept her dry in a unique way.
meanings.sent4: His nonbasic ideas were like colorful balloons in a gray sky.
meanings.sent5: The nonbasic ingredients in the recipe added a surprising twist.

meanings.sent1: The nonbasic characters in the story added depth to the plot.
meanings.sent2: The extra decorations on the cake are nonbasic but make it more festive.
meanings.sent3: The nonbasic hat she wore made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: His nonbasic approach to problem-solving was like a breath of fresh air.
meanings.sent5: The nonbasic elements in the music created a unique sound.
